intro: Hermannia filipes var. elatior, commonly known as the tall slender hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
